javax.time.zone

Class ZoneRulesProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.time.zone.ZoneRulesProvider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TzdbZoneRulesProvider

    public abstract class ZoneRulesProvider
extends Object
    Provider of time-zone rules to the system.

    This class manages time-zone rules. The static methods provide the public API that can be used to manage the providers. The abstract methods provide the SPI that allows rules to be provided.

    Rules are looked up be group, version and region. The group and region are expressed in the ZoneId, whereas the version is specific to the providers.

    Since time-zone rules are political, the data can change at any time. The set of current rules is managed by groups which publish new versions of the data set over time to handle the political changes. The default 'TZDB' group uses version numbering consisting of the year followed by a letter, such as '2009e' or '2012f'. Versions are assumed to be sortable in lexicographical order. Version IDs must match the regex [A-Za-z0-9._-]+.

    Caching is the responsibility of the SPI implementation. Any rules that are returned once for a given lookup must continue to be returned in the future.

    Many systems would like to receive new time-zone rules dynamically. This must be implemented separately from this interface, typically using a listener. Whenever the listener detects new rules it should call registerProvider(ZoneRulesProvider) using a standard immutable provider implementation.

    Implementation notes

    This interface is a service provider that can be called by multiple threads. Implementations must be immutable and thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableGroupIds

        public static Set<String> getAvailableGroupIds()
        Gets the set of available zone rule groups.

        Which groups are available is dependent on the registered providers.

        The returned groups will remain available and valid for the lifetime of the application as there is no way to deregister time-zone information. More groups may be added during the lifetime of the application, however the returned set will not be altered.

        The set should always contain 'TZDB'. The group 'UTC' is never included as it is handled entirely within ZoneId.

        Returns:
        a modifiable copy of the available group IDs, not null

      • getProvider

        public static ZoneRulesProvider getProvider(String groupId)
        Gets a group by ID, such as 'TZDB'.

        This gets the provider of rule data for the specified group.

        This method relies on time-zone data provider files. These are often loaded as jar files. If no providers have been registered or no provider has been registered for the requested group then an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        groupId - the group ID, not null
        Returns:
        the provider for the group, not null
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if there is no provider for the specified group

      • registerProvider

        public static void registerProvider(ZoneRulesProvider provider)
        Registers a zone rules provider.

        This adds a new provider to those currently available. Each provider is specific to one group and no two provider may supply information about the same group.

        To ensure the integrity of time-zones already created, there is no way to deregister providers.

        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to register, not null
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if the provider is already registered

      • getGroupId

        public final String getGroupId()
        Gets the ID of the group, such as 'TZDB'.
        Returns:
        the ID of the group, not null

      • getAvailableRegionIds

        public abstract Set<String> getAvailableRegionIds()
        Gets the set of available regions.

        This obtains the IDs of the available regions of rule data. A provider should provide data for at least one region.

        The returned regions remain available and valid for the lifetime of the application. A dynamic provider may increase the set of regions as more data becomes available.

        Not all combinations of region and version will be valid. Use isValid(String, String) to determine which combinations are valid.

        Returns:
        a modifiable copy of the available region IDs, not null

      • getAvailableVersionIds

        public abstract SortedSet<String> getAvailableVersionIds()
        Gets the set of available versions.

        This obtains the IDs of the available versions of rule data. A provider should provide data for at least one version.

        The returned versions remain available and valid for the lifetime of the application. A dynamic provider may increase the set of versions as more data becomes available.

        Not all providers support multiple versions of the data, so this method frequently returns a set of size one representing the "default" version. The null version, representing the "latest" version, will not be included in the set.

        The returned versions remain available and valid for the lifetime of the application. A dynamic provider may increase the set of versions as more data becomes available.

        Not all combinations of region and version will be valid. Use isValid(String, String) to determine which combinations are valid.

        Returns:
        a modifiable copy of the available version IDs, natural string sort order, not null

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid(String regionId,
              String versionId)
        Checks if the combination of region and version is valid.

        This checks whether rules can be obtained for the region. The version may be null to indicate the "latest" version. If this method returns true, the getRules(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method should return a set of rules for the same parameters.

        Parameters:
        regionId - the time-zone region ID, null returns false
        versionId - the time-zone version ID, null means "latest"
        Returns:
        true if rules can be obtained

      • getRules

        public abstract ZoneRules getRules(String regionId,
                 String versionId)
        Gets rules for the combination of region and version.

        This loads the rules for the region and version specified. The version may be null to indicate the "latest" version.

        Parameters:
        regionId - the time-zone region ID, not null
        versionId - the time-zone version ID, null means "latest"
        Returns:
        the rules, not null
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if rules cannot be obtained

      • refresh

        public abstract boolean refresh(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Refreshes the rules from the underlying data provider.

        This method provides the opportunity for a provider to dynamically recheck the underlying data provider to find the latest rules. This could be used to load new rules without stopping the JVM. Dynamic behavior is entirely optional and most providers do not support it.

        Parameters:
        classLoader - the class loader to use, not null
        Returns:
        true if the rules were updated
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if an error occurs during the refresh
